alert.note: Alert for Champaign; De Witt; McLean; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 19 at 1:18AM CDT until September 19 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN PIATT...NORTHEASTERN DE WITT...SOUTHEASTERN MCLEAN AND CHAMPAIGN COUNTIES... At 118 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Thomasboro, or 7 miles northeast of Champaign, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... St. Joseph, Sidney, Ogden and Homer. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 232 and 253. Interstate 72 between mile markers 177 and 182. Interstate 74 between mile markers 154 and 197. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
